benchmark_details.name: Mangosteen: An Open Thai Corpus for Language Model Pretraining
benchmark_details.overview: Mangosteen is a large-scale pre-training dataset for the Thai language, consisting of 47.4 billion tokens, developed to improve the quality and accessibility of Thai pre-training data for language models. The dataset is created using an adapted Dolma pipeline tailored to the Thai language, with sources including Common Crawl, Wikipedia, and government documents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality, reproducible Thai corpus for language model pretraining, addressing the linguistic and cultural specificities of the Thai language.

data.source: Data collected from Common Crawl, Wikipedia, Creative Commons licensed content, legal documents, and other curated sources.
data.annotation: Automated filtering and cleaning processes using adapted pipelines.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance evaluations on the SEA-HELM and Thai LLM benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: An increase in benchmark scores indicates improved dataset quality and model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: A performance increase from 3 to approximately 11 points in the SEA-HELM benchmark.
methodology.validation: Validated through systematic ablation studies demonstrating the contribution of each data cleaning step.
